name: Radisson Blu Warwick Hotel Philadelphia

reviews.text: We booked via internet on the Radisson site for a 2 night hot deal (99 dollars per night plus taxes). I have been to the Radisson in Stockholm and Lisbon, and everything was great. So I was pretty confident in a nice room and a wonderful stay. Not at all. We were first offered a room at the 20th floor (uau!). The only problem is that this floor AC were off (if you've been to Philly during summer time you know what this means) and the room was right in front of the ice machine. So we moved to a room on the 7th floor, enormous, but without the fridge and safe. The internal AC system was broken and flooded the moquette one meter around it. The tapisserie was kept on the walls by means of adhesive naster. Last, but not least we received the confirmation bill outside our door at 2.30 AM (!) of the second night.
reviews.title: Hot deals terrible deals

reviews.text: The reception staff was indeed nice, anyway.
reviews.title: Great Hotel....Great Location!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel on recommendation from Tripadvisor. We were pleasantly surprised. I was traveling with my husband and two small children. The hotel was a nice treat considering we really didn't know what to expect.
reviews.title: I loved it!!

reviews.text: Check-in was easy. The people at the front desk were very courteous and friendly.
reviews.title: Ratskin
A Very Nice Experience
reviews.text: The room was large it had two queen size beds, a little area with a desk and the bathroom. Yes, the room and bathroom could use some updating, but they were very clean and comfortable. This is not a 300$ a night hotel, so I was not expecting silk sheets. We paid $100 a night.

We had a terrible experience at this hotel while attending the ASI convention in May 24-23 2005. The front desk was rude and very inconsiderate when advising us that our reservation for a king room made over a month ago was over-booked. But they did offer us a pull-out queen sleeper in a room they call the parlor!!! I felt like I was in a seinfeld episode where the manager Dwaine and his 2 flunky assistants at the front desk were convinced that a reservation met nothing and the customer would just go away. If you stay here an experience this situation it is probably because you booked for only one night. Don't let that stop you, call the 1-800 number for radison and complain. The brochures are at the front desk for the number. The corporate headquarters were very helpful and seemed to be as surprized as we were when told of an offer for a queen sleeper. I choose another attendant who was obviously not a manger but was kind enough to verify we indeed did have a king room reservation but it was obvious that the magement hawks would never allow her to check us in. It was pretty apparent that the check in line for one night stays were sent to the managers desk to plead there case. After talking to everyone in line it was apparent that everyone in the managers line was there for the same reason, reservation number in hand but no room and booked for one night. After 1 1/2 hours of complaining and basically making a scene, they finally gave us our room. We refused to be sent down the road to the overflow! I had to insist on a free drink and dinner. After only getting a drink card I warned the manager that my dinner reservation that I missed and the drink card may be a bad combination since I don't drink very well on an empty stomoch. They threw in a dinner at the circle restaraunt with a smirk and please leave us alone look. The dinner at the circle was great so don't believe the bad reviews. Its now under new management (Brian) who was very sympathetic to our experience and made our evening wonderful.
reviews.title: Awful experience!
Don't stay here if you want a smoke-free, odor-free environment
reviews.text: BOttom line, ask for Brian in the resteraunt and do stay at this hotel and make the front desk and mangers job as miserable as possible as they are obviously doing for hundreds of people a day. "Yes...pay backs are OK!" Donald Trump said this at the ASI conference on dealing with people.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!
reviews.text: I bid it at priceline and get it for $75/night during Labor Day weekend, comparing to $99 at expedia or travelocity. The hotel is located a little off main attraction areas, Independence Hall and Chinatown. Easy check-in and the receptionist is very polite, with big smile, and very helpful. I requested a king-size bed on 19th floor, which required roomkey to activate the elevator. Absolutely fantastic. HUGE room. Clean and up-to-date bathroom. The hotel even provide bathing robes, cool. Others like safe, coffee maker, CD/FM/AM/Alarm clock, internet (surcharge, $9.95), local magazines. Check out time is 12pm, very nice.

reviews.title: Clean and Pleasant
reviews.text: Just minor complain, valet parking is $24 overnight(unlimited in and out), which is quite expensive. Self-parking is $20. If you stay on Sat or Sun, park a block down, which is just $9 for whole day.
Other than that, this is truly a 3 1/2 stars hotel. You'll like it for sure.
reviews.title: Very happy and well worth the price
pretty good
reviews.text: If you want to stay in a luxurious hotel, this is not it. HOWEVER, if you are looking for a clean and friendly place to stay with access to the city and shopping, then you have found your match! I think the radisson employs the friendliest and kindest bunch! George, the check in person called up to the room after we settled in to make sure it was to our liking. There was plenty of room and it was clean, what more can you ask for. The room service was good, i recommend the chocolate mousse. You are near tons of great shopping and some great places to eat. Had a lovely dinner just around the corner on Walnut (b/w 17th and 18th) called Pietro's. That is if you have an inkling for some italian. If your on a budget, and location and cleanliness is important, the Radisson should be high on your list!

Stayed on Sun and we really enjoyed the Radisson. The lobby is very nice and classy, the Bartender Mike was extremely friendly as were all the employees. The room was clean and the bath was very nice. The coffee bar was a big hit with my wife and the area is great. We booked a great deal with priceline and I would be glad to stay here again.
reviews.title: Good deal in the heart of Philly

reviews.text: We spent 7 nights in this Radisson Hotel and had a very good holiday there. We arrived in a deluge and the weather was drizzly for most of our week which surprised us as we expected better. We don't get so much rain at home!!
reviews.title: Good central position
Radisson Warwick/Locust St/Center City
reviews.text: George at Reception was charming and when I asked for a spacious room because we were going to be there for a week he gave us a lovely big room which had been refurbished recently. Nice bathroom and two queen beds which were firm and that's how we like them as we both have bad backs.
The tips we left for our housekeeper elicited a lovely Thank you note which was the first time that had ever happened. I feel that housekeepers get forgotten sometimes and I like to remember them.
reviews.title: Radissons in Scandinavia much better than American Radissons

reviews.text: Dinner in The Prime Rib(under separate management) was memorable. Just fabulous but expensive. They do an early bird menu for $30 which was great value but it was very early so it might not suit everybody.
reviews.title: So nearly luxurious...

reviews.text: Little Pete's Diner across the street is fantastic value and good food so we breakfasted there every morning. Pietro's Italian a few 100 yards away is also a good place to eat especially for families.
reviews.title: It is ok, sorta

description: Sophisticated. Stylish. Uniquely Philadelphia. Radisson Blu Warwick Hotel is where history meets innovation and culture. This hotel is high on design and style and located in Philadelphia’s most prestigious address, Rittenhouse Square.
